meanings.definition: The quality of being pleasant and friendly.
meanings.sent1: Her congeniality made everyone feel welcome at the party.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy working with people who have congeniality.
meanings.sent3: His congeniality was so infectious that even grumpy Bob cracked a smile.
meanings.sent4: The congeniality of the small town was like a warm hug.
meanings.sent5: The congeniality of the team created a positive work environment.

meanings.sent1: She has a congeniality that brightens up any room.
meanings.sent2: His congeniality makes him a joy to be around.
meanings.sent3: The cat's congeniality towards the dog was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her congeniality was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The congeniality of the host made the event truly special.

meanings.definition: The ability to get along well with others.
meanings.sent1: His congeniality helps him build strong relationships.
meanings.sent2: Teamwork requires a certain level of congeniality.
meanings.sent3: The congeniality between the siblings was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: In negotiations, congeniality can lead to better outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The congeniality of the group made the project a success.
